particlerain.title: Particle Rain Configuration
particlerain.PerformanceOptions.descript: Lowering these will reduce the amount of particles on screen, making the game run faster at the cost of more sparse looking effects
particlerain.PerformanceOptions.maxParti: New weather particles will not be spawned if there are this many already in the world.
particlerain.PerformanceOptions.particle: Controls how many new particles will spawn per tick.
Controls how many new particles will spawn per tick during storms.
How many blocks away particles will appear.
particlerain.PerformanceOptions.surfaceR: How many blocks away particles spawned at the world's surface will appear.
particlerain.SoundOptions.doMaterialSoun: Makes the rain splashing noise match the material of the block it's falling onto.
particlerain.WindOptions.gustFrequency.d: Lower frequency increases the length of each wind gust.
particlerain.WindOptions.modulationSpeed: How fast the wind shifts over time.
particlerain.WindOptions.yLevelAdjustmen: Makes wind stronger higher up, and disabled below ground level.
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.waterT: Tint water particles with biome colors
Applies color to rain, streaks, drops, and splashes.
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.tintMi: How much tinted water particles reflect the sky color instead of the water color.
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.shader: Only use sky color when shaders are enabled
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.syncRe: Disable this if Particle Rain is preventing players from connecting to your LAN server.
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.crossB: Allows particles to drift into climates with a different temperature.
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.useHei: Prevents snow falling where it should be raining in biomes where the weather can vary by height, such as the Windswept Hills.
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.doSpaw: Prevents weather particles from spawning above the cloud height.
particlerain.CompatibilityOptions.spawnH: The height at which particles are considered to be spawning above clouds. When set to a value of zero the mod will use the cloud height from the current world.
particlerain.ParticleData.id.description: The string used to identify the particle in the registry, commands, and translations.
particlerain.ParticleData.density.descri: The frequency the particle will spawn at relative to the overall particle density.
particlerain.suggest: Enter a world to see suggestions
particlerain.ParticleData.rotationAmount: How much the particle will rotate per tick.
particlerain.ParticleData.opacity.descri: How see-through the particles are from fully transparent (0) to fully opaque (100).
particlerain.ParticleData.constantScreen: Scales the particle by distance so that it remains the same size on the screen.
particlerain.ParticleData.renderType.des:
Defines how translucency is handled. 
BLENDED type may render incorrectly with some mods and is incompatible with shaderpacks as of Minecraft 1.21.5.
particlerain.ParticleData.useResourcepac: Uses the resolution of the campfire smoke particle.
